issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies Pneumatic.raisePressure(int) with return type void, but the solution repository declares Pneumatic.raisePressure(int) with return type boolean. At the same time the solution's implementing classes (LaunchedDropdownTower and LaunchedRollerCoaster) implement raisePressure(int) as void. This creates a direct signature mismatch: the interface in the solution does not match the UML/specification and also contradicts the implementing classes, which would lead to compilation errors and confusion about the intended return type.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Pneumatic.raisePressure(int) signature across artifacts. Either: (A) Change the solution interface method to match the UML/specification: declare 'void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease);' in Pneumatic.java and keep the implementing classes' void overrides; or (B) If a boolean return was intended, update the problem statement/UML to state 'boolean raisePressure(int)' and update the implementing classes to return boolean consistently. Preferred fix: update Pneumatic.java in the solution to 'void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease);' so it matches the UML and the implementing classes.
